messages.text:
This looks like a bug to me: `Distributed.interrupt` seems to fail in non-interactive contexts. Does anybody have an idea what goes on?
<https://stackoverflow.com/questions/65788774/why-julia-s-distributed-interrupt-terminates-workers>

attachments.title: Why Julia’s `Distributed.interrupt` terminates workers?
attachments.text: I’m confused what the function Distributed.interrupt() does. Documentation says it will ‘interrupt the current executing task on the specified workers’ but it seems to terminate the workers as well.
